Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2013 02:14PM JaLoLa wrote: Hello fenella,  The transducers are the wands they use. She called them "cameras". I don't have much information, which is the worst because I am the kind of person who needs to know.
Posts.Title: breast ultrasound lindalane JaLoLa

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2013 11:40AM JaLoLa wrote: I just had breast ultrasound number 2. She asked me to find my lump (it's on my R breast, 10:00) and she was able to feel it too, she asked if I thought it was around the size of a pea. And she wrote "ARAD 10:00-11:00" on my ultrasound. She used 2 different transducers. Has anyone had the same thing? I think they might be comparing this scan to my last to see if its a cyst? Any input would be appreciated.
Posts.Title: breast ultrasound lindalane JaLoLa

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2013 05:03PM JaLoLa wrote: Try to stay busy and spend time with your little one. Most lumps turn out not to be cancer. Truthfully, only you know what will make you feel better. Praying everything turns out ok for you.
Posts.Title: Tired of Waiting-Advice? Chi2013 Chi2013

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2013 04:33PM JaLoLa wrote: Diane,  I am so sorry for how you have been treated during your journey with breast cancer. I applaud your message because to them we might be just another ultrasound, mammogram or biopsy but to us it is a life changing, terrifying test and simple human decency and a little empathy would be appreciated.  I wish you luck with everything in the future.
Posts.Title: A Letter To My Doctors Bendcoles marie5890

Posts.Content: JaLoLa wrote: I was just wondering if anyone could share a similar experience or reassure me things are normal.. In December, I found my first lump. I had an U/S and it came back normal. Then for some reason, shortly after I had a second U/S, which came back with a fibroglandular ridge of tissue.  I recently had a pelvic exam and the doctor did a breast exam, found a lump in the opposite breast. She ordered a bi-lateral ultrasound. She told me I had dense breasts and was not a candidate for mammography (I'm 27 btw). Today I got the results and it says all is normal. So my question is, did the fibraglandular ridge somehow disappear or do radiologists not have to mention that on an ultrasound report?  I hate doctor vague-ness. I am so grateful things appear fine, but these last US results just seem like laziness.  Please weigh in. I'd truly appreciate it.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Variances between Ultrasounds JaLoLa MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2013 04:59PM JaLoLa wrote: I need some input ladies... I had 2 ultrasounds. The first one was "normal right breast" US. The second one noted a "ridge of fibroglandular tissue" where my lump was found. My GP ordered a mammogram. I am worried because I wonder how effective a mammogram will be. I have seen some posts where women with dense breast tissue find out years later they had cancer all along that was difficult to diagnose. I am not looking for the cancer to be there. I would just hate to know I didn't explore all my options when I first found it. I would love LOVE to hear from other women with fibroglandular tissue.  Thanks
Posts.Title: What would you do next? jrk7382 JaLoLa
